group_1.narration: ―Mikoto―@How are we supposed to@directly ruin a family?
―Hanna―@We just gotta use a little bit of suggestion.
―Hanna―@That's all it takes to rip apart a family@and make it meaningless.
―Hanna―@Let's start with a warm-up.
―Hanna―@Take this couple celebratin' their anniversary…@If we use suggestion to force them to be honest…

group_1.textLeft: I'm fed up with your constant whining and@complaining!

group_1.textRight: I'm sick of you, too! You hardly make any money@and you act like you're the king of the world!

group_1.textLeft: Wh-what?!

group_1.textRight: Divorce! I want a divorce! I've been wanting@to say that for a long time!

group_1.narration: ―Hanna―@Well, how's that?
―Hanna―@Ooh, looks like they ain't doin' so well, 'cause all this time,@they've been lyin' to keep up appearances…
―Hanna―@So once you take out all the lies proppin' 'em up,@there's nothing much else to do but collapse.
―Hanna―@Even here, if we use a different suggestion…

group_1.textLeft: And you know what else?! I've been hiding it@until now, but I've been cheating on you!

group_1.textRight: Excuse me?!

group_1.textLeft: I know you've been trying to conceal your debt@from me!

group_1.textRight: Hey, I deserve to have some fun, too!

group_1.textLeft: Kyaaaah! What the hell are you doing here?!

group_1.textRight: And you! You've always hated your parents,@haven't you?
Ahaha! You're tryin' to cover it up, but there's@no point! Your eyes shine just like mine did!
You've already been exposed…so let's make@the truth come out, too!

group_1.textLeft: Wh-What's the matter with you?!@Why do you have that in your hand…?!

group_1.textRight: Shut up! Get out of my sight!

group_1.textLeft: What do you think you're doing?!@We're your parents!

group_1.textRight: That's rich considering you stopped acting@like it a long time ago!

group_1.narration: …All these voices spread throughout the city.
A family can be pulled apart so easily…

group_1.textLeft: We're getting a divorce!

group_1.textRight: I give up on this house!

group_1.textLeft: I wish my family would disappear!

group_1.textRight: AHAHAHAHAHAHA!
How's that, Sena? We ruined 'em all!
*Giggle* …We sure have.

group_1.textLeft: I feel stupid for having ever worried about it.

group_1.textRight: Ahaha! That's good to hear.

group_1.textLeft: …Hey, Hanna. You figured it out, didn't you?

group_1.textRight: Hm? What's that?

group_1.textLeft: That I'd lied to you about my family…

group_1.textRight: …Ehh, I wouldn't really call it a lie.

group_1.textLeft: It doesn't change the fact that I'd deceived you.
And…I didn't just lie about my family.@I lied about school, too.

group_1.textRight: Did you now?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah…

group_1.narration: All that stuff I said about having lots of friends…@About having such a wonderful time there…
I think I said that to you, but…@none of that was real.
I don't have any good memories of school.
I wanted to make friends,@to chat with my classmates,@to have places to go after school,@to hang out with people.
I just wanted normal things like that.
But if people knew I came from a bad family,@they'd start avoiding me…so I lied and@pretended like my family was normal.
As a result…I could never invite my friends over.
I didn't have any money,@so I never had a proper lunch…@I didn't want anyone else to know,@so I always ate alone.
I couldn't even go places with people@after school because I couldn't afford it.
And since I lied about my family,@I couldn't use them as an excuse…@so I came to be seen as an outcast.
I couldn't go on like that,@so I tried to act cheerful and sociable,@but it didn't get me anywhere…
In the end, I got nothing I wanted.@Just false friends and a false self.

group_1.textLeft: …I'm sorry for lying so much, Hanna.
After telling one lie, I was too scared to tell you@the truth…
I was afraid you'd hate me…@That you'd think I was crazy…
In the end, I couldn't bring myself to confess@until now.
But given the way I am now, I have nothing left@to lose.
And after you destroyed those families@so effortlessly…
*Giggle* It all just came tumbling out.

group_1.textRight: …I see.

group_1.textLeft: So when did you figure it out, Hanna?

group_1.textRight: Mm… I got the feeling from our exchange diary.
I knew something was up with you and school.

group_1.textLeft: Huh? How so?

group_1.textRight: 'Cause there was no way someone as brilliant@as that would hang out with someone like me.
…I knew we had to be in the same boat.

group_1.textLeft: So that's how it is…
I should've been more honest with you…
Maybe things would've turned out differently.

group_1.textRight: …Well, something like that wouldn't make me@hate you.

group_1.textLeft: I know…
I know, and that's why I couldn't tell you.

group_1.textRight: Huh?

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* …I feel lighter somehow.

group_1.textRight: Sounds like you got some closure, huh?

group_1.textLeft: Closure…
Most people would find closure through more@respectable ways.
And…they grow up as a result.
*Giggle* I guess we really are different from@everyone else.

group_1.textRight: What're you actin' like it's wrapped up for, huh?@We've got so much left to do!

group_1.textLeft: Like what?

group_1.textRight: We gotta go after your school, duh!
Alright, we snuck in!

group_1.textLeft: I'm glad we made it, but…what's that you have@there, Hanna? A bucket?

group_1.textRight: Yep! A bucket full of paint!

group_1.textLeft: Paint?

group_1.textRight: Well, at first I thought we'd do the usual@smashing the windows out thing…

group_1.textLeft: Oh, like delinquents.

group_1.textRight: Exactly! And that's just not how we roll…
So I figured we oughta use some paint@to express our feelings instead!

group_1.textLeft: Erm…through graffiti?

group_1.textRight: Eh, that ain't the right word…
Let's call it poetry instead!

group_1.textLeft: I feel like graffiti would be better.

group_1.textRight: Well, whatever…you've got a lot you wanna say,@don'tcha?
Let's ruin your school with some good old@youthful indiscretion!
